critique: This document establishes an emergency board to investigate a dispute between a railroad company and its employees. It does not seem to have a strong ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on social inclusion. It could be argued that it expands executive power slightly by creating the board, but it is a temporary measure. It also seems to favor federal intervention in a labor dispute that affects interstate commerce. It does not directly address national security vs. civil liberties. It also involves government intervention in the economy to prevent disruption of transportation services.
